poem:
**Vote-a-Rama**

In the echo of footsteps  
down marble halls,  
a tired assembly of voices  
rises and falls,  
proposing, opposing,  
the grand choreography  
of democracy,  
while under frescoed ceilings  
pale pages rustle—  
ornate signatures inked,  
a ballet of pages  
in a house  
where the past,  
like dust,  
settles quietly  
on seats of power.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
